poem:
Title: Strife in the Eastern Vineyard

Between Black and Caspian, a nation reels,
In the grip of unrest, the old wine suffers.
Of Eastern vineyards, where breeze hints tales,
A silence broods, broken by the sufferer's cries.
Gregorian chants ride the Caucasus gust,
Against the slamming gavel, the voices thrust.
Bitter is the bill, sparked by foreign trust,
Yet in hope's resilient vessel, faith they entrust.
